snippet: The war that has lasted decades between the "Today" show, in first place, and "Good Morning America," in second place, is drawing attention again, thanks to tightening ratings and a very public booking battle.
abstract: The war that has lasted decades between the "Today" show, in first place, and "Good Morning America," in second place, is drawing attention again, thanks to tightening ratings and a very public booking battle.

headline.main: Booking Battle at the Morning Shows
